messages.message: In converse, we have the ability to very easily see the grounding for the answers returned by our LLMs. Why is this not also in chatbots?

@Victor Zeng can you share the chatbot URL?

cc: @Gauti

The display of bounding boxes for query results depends on the model used and the query scope within.
*Converse:*
• Bounding boxes are exclusively available for *single-document queries*.
• This feature is triggered when Converse utilizes the *advanced model* for single-document queries.
• For multi-docs, It will trigger other models, such as `multistep-lite(normal model)` and `multi-step (research mode)`, which do not support bounding box display.
• So, even converse with multi-doc queries will not have bounding box in it
*Chatbots:*
• Chatbots are designed with the assumption of handling *collections of documents*, not single documents.
• Consequently, Chatbots primarily support the `multistep-lite (normal mode)` and `multi-step (research mode)` models.
Therefore, bounding boxes will *not be displayed* in Chatbots, even when a query involves only a single document.
